intro: Calamintha ilicifolia, commonly known as sweet cicely, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its roots and seeds are used in traditional medicine for their aromatic and digestive properties. Calamintha ilicifolia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands and meadows.
